metadata.title: CVE-2019-20429 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - low
metadata.description:
In the Lustre file system before 2.12.3, the ptlrpc module has anout-of-bounds read and panic (via a modified lm_bufcount field) due to thelack of validation for specific fields of packets sent by a client. This iscaused by interaction between sptlrpc_svc_unwrap_request andlustre_msg_hdr_size_v2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20429` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-raspi package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1005.7').
linux-gke package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1003.5').
linux-ibm package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1009.9').
linux-lowlatency package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-9.9.1').
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1003.3').
linux-intel package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1001.6').
